      • loadMaps

        private void loadMaps()
        Called after loadBuilding(), this method uses building to decode and load the floors into memory, and sets the current floor. Due to the way android handles resources, we must unfortunately hard-code the images that it loads, though using the helper method getImageResourceFromCode(String) makes this easily swappable.

      • setListeners

        void setListeners()
        Where the magic happens. This one sets all the listeners (classes (but basically just methods) that respond to events)

      • loadBuilding

        void loadBuilding()
        Attempts to load the building from assets. Should never fail on a working build as the assets don't change, but handles errors because java doesn't like it if it doesn't

        public boolean onNavigationItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem item)

      • startNavSelect

        private void startNavSelect(android.widget.Button btn)
        Changes the app state st when you select a location, it is used for navigation. Sets the text, icon and listener of the button it came from
        Parameters:
        btn - The Button object that this came from, one of navigation_src_btn or navigation_dst_btn

      • exitNavigation

        private void exitNavigation()
        The navigation-specific counterpart to deselect(). If a location was selected before we started navigation, go back to showing it. Otherwise just hides the nav UI

      • cancelNavSelect

        private void cancelNavSelect(android.widget.Button btn)
        Reverses the effects of startNavSelect(android.widget.Button)
        Parameters:
        btn - The Button object that this came from, one of navigation_src_btn or navigation_dst_btn

      • startNavigationTo

        private void startNavigationTo(uk.ac.bris.cs.spe.navigationaltool.graph.Location l)
        Brings up the navigation interface with the given location as the destination
        Parameters:
        l - The location to nav to. Currently this is always == selectedLocation, but once we have a new search interface this may be called separately

      • setNavigationSrc

        private void setNavigationSrc(uk.ac.bris.cs.spe.navigationaltool.graph.Location l)
        Sets the source of the current navigation route to the given Location, including setting button text and performing the navigation if appropriate
        Parameters:
        l - The Location to be the new source

      • resetNavButtons

        private void resetNavButtons()
        Sets the navigation buttons back to their original state.

      • setNavigationDst

        private void setNavigationDst(uk.ac.bris.cs.spe.navigationaltool.graph.Location l)
        Basically identical to setNavigationSrc(Location). The two could be combined but that would require more parameters
        Parameters:
        l - The Location to be the new destination
        See Also:
        setNavigationSrc(Location)

      • doNavigation

        private void doNavigation()
        The big one, the one we've all been waiting for, The actual point of our app. Uses the Navigator to compute the path between all pairs of nodes x,y, where the codes of x and y match those of navigationSrc and navigationDst respectively, then selects the path with the lowest total weight using weight(List). It draws this route to the buffer using MapView.drawPathListToBuffer(List, Paint), places dots at the start and end of the route, then shows the buffer.

      • onPhotoTap

        public void onPhotoTap(android.widget.ImageView view,
                       float x,
                       float y)
        Selection by search. Note that it calls select(Location) not showLocation(Location) as selection may be used for navigation not just display
        Specified by:
        onPhotoTap in interface com.github.chrisbanes.photoview.OnPhotoTapListener
        Parameters:
        view - The origin of the event. In our case always == mapView
        x - The 0-1 value denoting the x on the image of the tap
        y - The 0-1 value denoting the y on the image of the tap

        l - The selected Location

      • weight

        private int weight(java.util.List<uk.ac.bris.cs.spe.navigationaltool.graph.Path> p)
        Used by doNavigation() to find the best route
        Parameters:
        p - A list of paths
        Returns:
        The sum of the weights of all paths in p

      • absDist

        private double absDist(uk.ac.bris.cs.spe.navigationaltool.graph.Location l,
                       float x,
                       float y)
        Parameters:
        l - A location
        x - X-value of a point
        y - Y-value of a point
        Returns:
        the Euclidean distance (in px) of a Location l from the point x,y

      • idToInt

        private int idToInt(int id)
        Because we can't store User objects primitively, it makes sense to convert them into types that can denote access rights and ability. This function converts the ID of a MenuItem (specifically, those in the drawer) to an int which we can store using SharedPreferences. We can't just use the int ID of the MenuItem because its value can change between builds. This value corresponds to that of the access variable that stores the current access rights.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the MenuItem that has been selected
        Returns:
        The integer value representing the access level corresponding to the MenuItem
        See Also:
        for an example of usage

      • intToId

        private int intToId(int in)
        Inverse of idToInt(int)
        Parameters:
        in - The value to convert to the ID
        Returns:
        The ID of the MenuItem corresponding the the access level represented by in

      • getImageResourceFromCode

        private int getImageResourceFromCode(java.lang.String s)
        Because we can't do a direct string -> resource function, this helper will have to be used. The alternative would be to use the assets/ folder instead of res/, however this would remove the option to have different images for devices with different dpi.
        Parameters:
        s - floor code
        Returns:
        The image associated with s
